children.name: Electrician
children.information: A tradesperson specializing in electrical wiring of buildings

children.name: Plumber
children.information: A tradesperson who specializes in installing and maintenance

children.name: Carpenter
children.information: A skilled trade in performing cutting, shaping and installation

children.name: Painter
children.information: The practice of applying paint, pigment, color to a solid surface.

children.name: Merchanic
children.information: A mechanic is a tradesman, craftsman, or technician who uses tools to build or repair machinery.

children.name: Welder
children.information: A welder or lit operator is a tradesperson who specializes in fusing materials together.

children.name: Sikafone Agent
children.information: Agents responsible for convenient and secure way of transferring money, payments and doing other transactions using a Sikafone

children.name: Other Mobile Money
children.information: A certified agents to ensure customers have a good experience with Mobile Money Services

children.name: Farmer
children.information: People engaged in agriculture, raising living organisms.

children.name: Butcher
children.information: A person who may slaughter animals, dress their flesh

children.name: Food Vendor
children.information: Street food is ready-to-eat food or drink sold by a hawker

children.name: Fisherman
children.information: A person who catches fish for a living or for sport.

children.name: Police Station
children.information: police officers and other members of staff.

children.name: Fire Service
children.information: Rescue service agency under ministry of interior

children.name: Hospital
children.information: A health care institution providing patient treatment with specialized medical and nursing staff and medical equipment

children.name: Clinic
children.information: a healthcare facility that is primarily focused on the care of outpatients. Clinics can be privately operated or publicly managed and funded.

children.name: Herbal Center
children.information: Centers practicing of the medicinal and therapeutic use of plants.

children.name: Computer Engineer
children.information: A discipline that develop computer hardware and software.

children.name: Counselor
children.information: A person whose job is to provide advice, help, or encouragement

children.name: Banker
children.information: One who conducts the business of banking as a member of a company

children.name: Administrator
children.information: People who are responsible for carrying out the administration of a business.

children.name: Journalist
children.information: A person who collects, writes, or distributes news, current information.

children.name: Lawyer
children.information: People who practices law, as a paralegal, advocate, barrister, attorney, counselor, solicitor

children.name: Doctor
children.information: Professional who practises medicine, which is concerned with promoting, restoring health through the study

children.name: Nurse
children.information: Profession focused on the care for people and help to recover optimal health and quality of life

children.name: Teacher
children.information: A person who helps others to acquire knowledge, competences or values

children.name: Tertiary
children.information: post-secondary education, is the educational level following the completion of a school providing a secondary education.

children.name: High schools
children.information: A secondary school is both an organization that provides secondary education

children.name: Junior High schools
children.information: A middle school is an educational stage which exists in some countries, providing education between primary school and high school.

children.name: Training Institutions
children.information: Public or private institution of higher education which has implemented a training program for public school teachers designed to improve skills

children.name: Vocational
children.information: Prepares people to work in various jobs, such as a trade, a craft, or as a technician.

children.name: Technical
children.information: institutions, and educational programs that specialize in the skilled trades, applied sciences, modern technologies, and career preparation.
